intro: Byttneria melastomifolia var. affinis, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by berries that turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
